CLAUDE Contribution Guidelines

Source: CLAUDE.md

This document provides guidelines for AI assistants (specifically Claude) contributing to the oRm package.

Package Overview

oRm is a lightweight Object-Relational Mapper (ORM) for R that simplifies database interactions through an R6-based framework. The package provides declarative model definitions, relationship management, and CRUD operations without requiring raw SQL.

Core Architecture

  • Engine: Database connection manager with multi-dialect support (PostgreSQL, SQLite, MySQL)
  • TableModel: Table representation with schema management and CRUD interface
  • Record: Individual row operations with transaction support
  • Column/ForeignKey: Field definitions with constraints and relationships
  • Dialect System: Database-specific SQL generation

Development Guidelines

Code Style

  • Use 4 spaces for indentation; avoid tabs
  • Prefer snake_case for functions and variables
  • Use PascalCase for R6 class names (Engine, TableModel, Record)
  • Document all public functions with roxygen2 comments
  • Follow existing patterns for error handling and validation

File Organization

  • Core classes in R/ directory with descriptive names
  • Dialect-specific implementations in separate files (Dialect-*.R)
  • Tests organized in testthat/ with corresponding test files
  • Vignettes provide comprehensive usage examples

Documentation Standards

  • All public methods must have roxygen2 documentation
  • Include @description, @param, @return, and @examples sections
  • Use @seealso to cross-reference related functions
  • Document field attributes in R6 classes using @field
  • Never edit .Rd files - these are auto-generated by roxygen2

Testing Considerations

  • Do not attempt to run testthat - test dependencies are large
  • When adding features, consider test structure but don’t execute
  • Follow existing test patterns in tests/testthat/
  • Test files should mirror source file names (test-Engine.R, etc.)

Database Dialect Support

CRITICAL: Dialect-specific functions must NEVER be included in core classes (Engine, TableModel, Record, Relationship, etc.). All dialect-specific behavior must use the custom method dispatcher.

Method Dispatch System

oRm uses a custom method dispatcher (dispatch_method() in Dialect.R:39) for dialect-specific behavior:

# Correct - uses method dispatch
qualify(engine, tablename, schema)
set_schema(engine, schema)
flush(engine, table, data, con, commit)

# Incorrect - adding dialect logic to core classes
if (engine$dialect == "postgres") { ... }

Implementing Dialect-Specific Functions

When extending database support: - Create new dialect file following Dialect-*.R pattern - Implement dialect-specific methods using the naming convention: function_name.dialect_name - Provide default implementations with .default suffix - Add dialect detection logic in Engine$detect_dialect() - Use dispatch_method() for all dialect-dependent operations

Available Dialect Functions

Core dialect functions that use method dispatch: - qualify() / qualify.dialect - Schema-aware table name qualification - set_schema() / set_schema.dialect - Set database schema context - flush() / flush.dialect - Insert records with RETURNING support - ensure_schema_exists() / ensure_schema_exists.dialect - Create schema if needed - create_schema() / create_schema.dialect - Explicit schema creation

Example Implementation

# In Dialect-postgres.R
flush.postgres <- function(x, table, data, con, commit = TRUE, ...) {
    # PostgreSQL-specific implementation with RETURNING
}

# In Dialect-sqlite.R  
flush.sqlite <- function(x, table, data, con, commit = TRUE, ...) {
    # SQLite-specific implementation
}

# Default fallback in Dialect.R
flush.default <- function(x, table, data, con, commit = TRUE, ...) {
    # Generic implementation
}

Transaction Handling

  • Respect existing transaction state via engine$get_transaction_state()
  • Use with.Engine() for transaction blocks
  • Default to auto-commit when not in active transaction
  • Handle rollbacks gracefully with appropriate error messages

Relationship Management

  • Support standard relationship types: belongs_to, one_to_many, many_to_many
  • Maintain bidirectional relationship references (ref/backref)
  • Ensure proper foreign key constraint handling
  • Use appropriate read modes based on relationship cardinality

Git Workflow

Commit Messages

  • Use imperative mood (e.g., “Add support for”, “Fix bug in”, “Update documentation”)
  • Keep first line under 50 characters
  • Provide detailed explanation in body if needed
  • Reference issues with #issue-number

Branch Strategy

  • Work on feature branches from main
  • Use descriptive branch names (feature/add-mysql-support, fix/transaction-rollback)
  • Keep commits focused and atomic

Common Patterns

Error Handling

if (missing(required_param)) {
  stop("Required parameter 'required_param' must be provided")
}

tryCatch({
  # operation
}, error = function(e) {
  # cleanup and re-throw
  stop("Operation failed: ", e$message)
})

R6 Method Documentation

#' @description
#' Brief description of what the method does
#' @param param_name Parameter description
#' @return What the method returns
#' @examples
#' \dontrun{
#' # Example usage
#' }
method_name = function(param_name) {
  # implementation
}

Database Operations

  • Always use parameterized queries with DBI::dbQuoteLiteral()
  • Quote identifiers with DBI::dbQuoteIdentifier()
  • Handle schema qualification consistently
  • Respect connection pooling and persistence settings

Package Dependencies

Required Imports

  • DBI: Database connectivity
  • dbplyr: SQL generation and dplyr integration
  • dplyr: Data manipulation
  • R6: Object-oriented framework
  • pool: Connection pooling
  • rlang: Non-standard evaluation

Suggested Dependencies

  • testthat: Testing framework
  • knitr/rmarkdown: Documentation
  • stevedore: Docker testing
  • charlatan: Test data generation

Contribution Checklist

Before submitting changes:

Resources

  • Package source: https://github.com/kent-orr/oRm
  • Documentation: https://kent-orr.github.io/oRm/
  • Bug reports: https://github.com/kent-orr/oRm/issues
  • R6 documentation: https://r6.r-lib.org/
  • DBI documentation: https://dbi.r-dbi.org/

Do Nots

Do not spend time editing .Rd docs, as those ar eprogrammataicalyl generated by roxygen
